diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Cartilage hair hypoplasia with multiple basal cell carcinomas
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with a nonhealing papule which was biopsied and confirmed as superficial basal cell carcinoma (BCC). The patient has a known history of cartilage hair hypoplasia (CHH), which is associated with an increased risk of malignancy, particularly skin cancers. This association, along with the patient's clinical features and family history, supports the diagnosis.
